unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: Finding the Degrees of Freedom in a Slope $t$-Interval
question_text:
A statistician wants to construct a slope $t$-interval with $99\%$ confidence and a sample size of $18$.
What is the degrees of freedom?
solution:
The slope t-interval has degrees of freedom n−2, where n is the sample size.
When trying to remember that is n−2 degrees of freedom think about how many variables we have. We have 2 variables so our degrees of freedom is n−2.

In this case, the degrees of freedom is: 18−2=16.

Explanation of Distractors Choice 'B' is incorrect as the sample size was subtracted by one. Choice 'C' is incorrect as this is the sample size. Choice 'D' is incorrect as the sample size was added by one. Choice 'E' is incorrect as the sample size was added by two.
